## a. Highest and Lowest Split Values for Days

Split values are the midpoints between consecutive sorted unique values.

```{python}
days_sorted = sorted(df['Days'].unique())
days_splits = [(days_sorted[i] + days_sorted[i+1]) / 2 for i in range(len(days_sorted) - 1)]

print("Sorted Days values:", days_sorted)
print("Possible split values:", [round(s, 1) for s in days_splits])
print()
print(f"Highest split value: {round(max(days_splits), 1)}")
print(f"Lowest split value:  {round(min(days_splits), 1)}")
```
